intro: Rhexia lanceaeflora, commonly known as the lance-leaved rhexia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Rhexia lanceaeflora is a member of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
